content.question: Object <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and object <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are placed on the incline such that the motor moves the conveyor belt. The mass of object <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is greater than the mass of object <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. After both objects have been placed on the conveyor belt and travel at a constant speed, how does the rate of change of the gravitational potential energy of the object <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>–Earth system per unit of time <math alttext="delta U sub g X, over delta t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>Δ</mi></mstyle><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>g</mi><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>Δ</mi></mstyle><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> compare to that for the object <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>–Earth system <math alttext="delta U sub g Y, over delta t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>Δ</mi></mstyle><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>g</mi><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>Δ</mi></mstyle><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="delta U sub g X, over delta t, equals delta U sub g Y, over delta t, which equals 0 joules per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>Δ</mi></mrow></mstyle><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>g</mi><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>Δ</mi></mrow></mstyle><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>Δ</mi></mstyle><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>g</mi><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>Δ</mi></mrow></mstyle><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace></mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>J</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> , because the speed of the conveyor belt remains constant and both objects move at the same constant speed.

<math alttext="delta U sub g X, over delta t, equals delta U sub g Y, over delta t, which does not equal 0 joules per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>Δ</mi></mstyle><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>g</mi><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>Δ</mi></mstyle><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>Δ</mi></mstyle><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>g</mi><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>Δ</mi></mstyle><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>≠</mo><mn>0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace></mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>J</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> , because the speed of the conveyor belt remains constant and both objects move at a constant speed.

<math alttext="delta U sub g X, over delta t, is greater than delta U sub g Y, over delta t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>Δ</mi></mstyle><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>g</mi><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>Δ</mi></mstyle><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>></mo><mfrac><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>Δ</mi></mstyle><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>g</mi><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>Δ</mi></mstyle><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> , because object <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has a greater mass than object <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="delta U sub g X, over delta t, is less than delta U sub g Y, over delta t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>Δ</mi></mstyle><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>g</mi><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>Δ</mi></mstyle><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo><</mo><mfrac><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>Δ</mi></mstyle><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>g</mi><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>Δ</mi></mstyle><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> , because object <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has a greater mass than object <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="delta U sub g X, over delta t, is greater than delta U sub g Y, over delta t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>Δ</mi></mstyle><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>g</mi><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>Δ</mi></mstyle><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>></mo><mfrac><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>Δ</mi></mstyle><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>g</mi><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>Δ</mi></mstyle><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> , because object <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has a greater mass than object <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
